Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
This skill is meant for Philips Smart TV. To use this skill, you need to first setup the Alexa client service on your TV. Start the setup by launching the "Amazon Alexa" app from the Home screen of your TV. Follow the instructions and complete the following steps:
- Create an Amazon account if you don’t have it.
- Select a name for your Philips Smart TV for Alexa to recognise it.
- Register your Philips Smart TV on Amazon server using Code based linking. 
- Enable this skill on a mobile device, link accounts, and discover your devices. 
- Return to your TV to complete setup. 

1. SUPPORTED MODELS
Philips Smart TV models that support this feature will have the "Amazon Alexa" client app on the Home screen. If the selected models are bundled with a TV remote control that has an Alexa activation button, make sure your TV is paired with the remote control. Your TV should also be connected to the Internet. If the app is not on the Home screen, your TV may not be supporting this feature.
Additional information: https://apps.nettvservices.com/alexainfo/alexainfo.html?lang=uk

2. TV NAME
Use the TV name to tell Alexa which device to control. Pick a unique name for the TV you set up. For example: “TV”, “Living Room TV” etc.

3. VOICE CONTROL
You can trigger Alexa by pressing the Alexa activation button on the TV remote (selected models only). You will need to use the TV’s name when you want to control your TV with Alexa, e.g. “volume up on TV”, “next channel on Living room TV”, etc. First time you ask Alexa to control your Philips Smart TV using the TV name, Alexa will assume any applicable commands should control the same TV for a period of time. If you want to move away from controlling your TV, here are a few of the many things that you can ask Alexa to do.
“Alexa, what’s the weather today?” 
“Alexa, play a song”
“Alexa, read my audiobook”
“Alexa, show my to-do list”
“Alexa, set 5 minutes timer”
“Alexa, how big is Earth?”
“Alexa, what’s the news?”

You can use the following Amazon Alexa voice commands to control your Smart TV:
SWITCH TV ON/OFF 
"Alexa, turn on Living Room TV" (see note below)
"Alexa, turn off TV"
NOTE: Switching TV On will work only if the Alexa Switch on setting is enabled in the TV via the preferred settings in “Amazon Alexa” app from Home.

CHANGE CHANNEL
"Alexa, next channel on TV"
"Alexa, change channel to 5 on TV"

CHANGE VOLUME
"Alexa, set volume to 15 on Living Room TV"
"Alexa, volume down"

MUTE OR UNMUTE TV
"Alexa, mute TV"
"Alexa, unmute"

CHANGE INPUT SOURCE
"Alexa, switch input to Blu-ray on Bedroom TV"
"Alexa, switch input to HDMI 1 on TV"

CONTROL PLAYBACK
"Alexa, play on TV"
"Alexa, pause TV"
"Alexa, fast forward"
"Alexa, rewind"

CONTROL AMBILIGHT (see note below):
"Alexa, turn on Ambilight on Living Room TV"
"Alexa, turn on Ambilight Follow video on TV"
"Alexa, turn on Ambilight Follow audio on TV"
“Alexa, turn on Ambilight Lounge light on TV”
“Alexa, turn on Ambilight Follow flag on TV”
Note: The supported Ambilight styles may depend on specific TV models. 
Please refer the user manual of your TV to know the supported Ambilight styles.

LAUNCH APPLICATIONS OR SHORTCUTS**
“Alexa, launch Prime Video on TV”
“Alexa, go to Settings on TV”
“Alexa, go Home on TV”

SEARCH AND PLAY VIDEO CONTENT**
“Alexa, show me hot news on YouTube”
“Alexa, play Mr. Bean on YouTube”

Note:
** Supported voice commands may not be available for certain countries.

This is an example sequence of a possible conversation with Alexa:
You say, "Alexa, change channel to 5 on TV"
Alexa says, "Okay" and the TV tunes to channel 5.
You say, “Alexa, volume up”
Alexa says, “Okay” and the TV volume goes up.
You say, “Alexa, play Beat-it”
Alexa says, “Okay” and plays Beat-it on the TV.

SUPPORTED LANGUAGES
English(GB), English(US), French(FR), German(DE), Italian(IT), Spanish(ES)

4. TROUBLESHOOTING
If Alexa doesn't recognize your TV's name, say: "Discover my devices" or try running discovery in your Alexa app on a mobile device.
